intro: Licania crassivenia, commonly known as the thick-veined licania, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, where it thrives in humid, lowland environments. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
